title: Milwaukee police ID homicide victims
content:
Three people who were killed by gunfire earlier this week were identified by police Thursday.
The first victim, who was fatally shot in the 4000 block of N. 19th St. Tuesday, was identified as Canova D. Webb, 17.
A man who was shot to death while inside a home in the 4200 block of N. 51st Blvd. Wednesday was identified as Eric D. Holloway, 24.
Holloway was one victim of a double shooting, in which a 27-year-old Milwaukee woman was also shot and suffered serious injuries, according to a news release from the Milwaukee Police Department.
The third victim, who was found dead of a gunshot wound in an alley in the 4200 block of N. 16th St. Wednesday, was identified as Derrick Carson, 38. Carson's body was found around 9 p.m. Wednesday after officers responded to a report of a "suspicious auto" that had been running for a long time, according to a news release.
Milwaukee police continue to seek motives and search for suspects in all three homicides.
